nars.art

Class AdaptiveResonanceTheory2.in_param

  • java.lang.Object
    • nars.art.AdaptiveResonanceTheory2.in_param
  • Enclosing class:
    AdaptiveResonanceTheory2

    public static class AdaptiveResonanceTheory2.in_param
extends java.lang.Object
    In this structure are stored all input parameters important for run every art algorithm. They can be given by user or they are set as default

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      float alpha
      Input parameter alpha (-a) is used by real value ART algorithms.
      float beta
      Input parameter beta (-b) in ART 1 is a small positive integer.
      float error
      An input parameter -- fluctuation (-e), it is a highest possible error rate (%).
      int pass
      An input parameter -- a number of passes (-E), it is a maximum number of how many times an example Ek can be re-assigned.
      float vigilance
      Input parameter vigilance (-v) together with alpha (ART for real numbers input) or beta (ART 1) set up a similarity threshold.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    • Field Detail

      • beta

        public float beta
        Input parameter beta (-b) in ART 1 is a small positive integer. It influences a number of created clusters. The higher value the higher number of created clusters. The default is 1.
        For another ART implementations (based on real value input) beta is a learning constant. It has a range [0, 1]. The default is 0.5

      • vigilance

        public float vigilance
        Input parameter vigilance (-v) together with alpha (ART for real numbers input) or beta (ART 1) set up a similarity threshold. This threshold influence a minimum similarity under which an example Ek will be accepted by prototype. The higher value the higher number of clusters. It has a range [0,1]. The default is 0.1.

      • alpha

        public float alpha
        Input parameter alpha (-a) is used by real value ART algorithms. Together with vigilance set up a similarity threshold. This threshold influences a minimum similarity which is necessary for the example Ek to be accepted by the prototype. The range: [0,1/sqrt(dim)] where dim is a number of dimensions. The default is 1/sqrt(dim) * 1/2

      • pass

        public int pass
        An input parameter -- a number of passes (-E), it is a maximum number of how many times an example Ek can be re-assigned. If it reach this number the program will stop. The default is 100

      • error

        public float error
        An input parameter -- fluctuation (-e), it is a highest possible error rate (%). It means a maximum number (in %) of how many instances can be re-assign. If the real fluctuatio is lower than -e then program will stop. Default is 5% examples.

    • Constructor Detail

      • in_param

        public in_param()
